clips.what_happens_visually: Man in business suit points aggressively at the camera, then at a man in a sweater, then back at the camera. The flight attendant looks increasingly uncomfortable.
clips.dialogue_hook: Maybe we'll head to Moffett first, then have the guys hop you on to Jackson, okay?
clips.meme_caption:
Me, during sprint planning:
"Let's just add one more thing..."
clips.why_it_works: Relatable visual of feature creep and scope escalation.

clips.what_happens_visually: Man in business suit looks increasingly exasperated and annoyed as the other man explains why his proposed change of plans is actually more efficient. The flight attendant looks awkward.
clips.dialogue_hook: On flights like this, the boys like to go over the pole, so that technically is a little more north to south...
clips.meme_caption:
When the engineer tries to
explain why their way is better
clips.why_it_works: Captures the frustration of dealing with over-engineered solutions.

clips.what_happens_visually: Man in business suit looks at his laptop, then glares at the camera and mutters, "Goddamn motherfucker."
clips.meme_caption:
When the VC asks for *one*
more change to the deck

clips.what_happens_visually: A man in a suit is being given an update by an employee. He seems increasingly frustrated and angry.
clips.dialogue_hook: Moffett is 28.3 minutes closer. Barker should have dropped you off first, sir. Wait, what about headwinds or storm activity?
clips.meme_caption:
Me, after using Cursor for
10 minutes
clips.why_it_works: Captures the feeling of being nickel-and-dimed by a tool that's supposed to help.

clips.what_happens_visually: Man in suit points angrily at employee, then smiles.
clips.dialogue_hook: Fly each leg five more times and average them. It's the only way to be sure.
clips.meme_caption:
My boss after I spent
3 days on a POC

clips.what_happens_visually: An older man is shown to his new desk, which is inside a chain-link cage and filled with junk. He looks unimpressed.
clips.dialogue_hook: Here it is. This is your desk.
clips.meme_caption:
POV: You joined a startup
that promised "unlimited growth"
clips.why_it_works: Captures the reality of startup life vs. the promise.

clips.what_happens_visually: Man in a suit is talking to a woman with his back to the camera. He turns around and it's a different man, looking confused.
clips.dialogue_hook: Richard, I put together a panel of the most active users you ported over from PiperChat. But I'm not on PiperChat.
clips.meme_caption:
Me, trying to explain our
product roadmap to the team
clips.why_it_works: Highlights the disconnect between vision and reality.

clips.what_happens_visually: An older man with glasses walks through a server farm, carrying a sign that says "Conjoined Triangles of Success."
clips.dialogue_hook: Oh, hey, would you like to see your desk?
clips.meme_caption:
POV: You're a new hire
at a web3 company
clips.why_it_works: Uses a familiar visual to satirize the current state of web3.

clips.what_happens_visually: A man in a red shirt is holding a container of yogurt. The screen on the fridge says, "That Yogurt is Expired."
clips.meme_caption:
When your linter yells at
you for using deprecated code
clips.why_it_works: Relatable to the experience of coding.

clips.what_happens_visually: A man in a leather jacket stands in front of an orange Lamborghini and tells another man, "That man, I will pay you to fuck."
clips.dialogue_hook: That man, I will pay you to fuck.
clips.meme_caption:
VCs trying to get
Richard to sell to Gavin
clips.why_it_works: Highlights the transactional nature of VC relationships.
